page.title: 01Akenshawburn & Lewis Burn
page.content: The area covered by the "D-Block" denoted by G.R.03600588 is dominated by coniferous trees planted by the Forestry Commission. Steep sided valleys with fast-flowing{burns}are typical of the area. Dense forests cover all but the steepest slopes, apart from small areas alongside the streams and one patch of rough grazing near{Akenshawburn Cottages.}There are only two inhabited settlements,one at {The Forks}and the other at{ {Akenshawburn.} These settlements are reached by rough forestry roads which have replaced the old pack-roads which used to criss-cross the area. Deer,foxes,otters and adders are among the wild life to be found,whilst owls and kestrels are examples of the birdlife.
